com.stormpath.sdk.idsite

Class IDSiteRuntimeException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • com.stormpath.sdk.resource.ResourceException
            • com.stormpath.sdk.idsite.IDSiteRuntimeException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Error, Serializable

    public class IDSiteRuntimeException
extends ResourceException
    A sub-class of ResourceException representing an IDSite error.

    This is a generic RuntimeException encapsulating all the possible IDSite errors. It is not required to be explicitly catch or throw. However, for those interested in re-working the specific error, this class offers the rethrow() method. When invoked, this method will throw a new checked exception describing the specific IDSite error. It can be one of subclasses of IDSiteException:

    • InvalidIDSiteTokenException: indicating that the token is invalid. Reasons could be: expired token, the issued at time (iat) is after the current time, the specified organization name key does not exist in your Stormpath Tenant or because the specified organization is disabled.
    • IDSiteSessionTimeoutException: indicating that the session on ID Site has timed out.

    Since:
    1.0.RC5
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
